main event: Witness observed a bright white light, round in shape, approximately 30 feet in diameter moving across the northern sky at a high rate of speed over Concord, California.
interesting points: The sighting occurred in July 1966 and lasted for 2 minutes., The witness first saw the object when he was awakened by a bright light shining through his bedroom window., The object moved in a northwest direction before disappearing., The weather conditions at the time were clear skies, with stars visible., The witness was convinced the object was not an airplane, helicopter, satellite, or meteor.
witness description: Harry L. Sly, a 15 year old male living in Concord.
